title: Modern Economic Nonsense ‚Äî Next generation of wealth
body:
*Join BitDAO to earn a $BIT token¬†[here](https://aembassy.io/?mref=11)*

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/OKwhrzdqExioznVh3wK9j.jpg?height=173&width=291)


---

Personal wealth is now more accessible than ever. It‚Äôs easier than ever to start investing, and it costs less than ever to do so as well. The internet has made it possible to invest in stock market directly from your desk and get started with little or no money. However, the way we think about wealth has changed too. It used to be about reaching the top of the financial hill and staying there for as long as possible. Today that approach doesn‚Äôt work anymore. Instead of focusing on a single goal, we need to look at new ways to generate income, increase our spending power and build wealth for the future. Wealth is no longer just about having money in reserve for old age; instead it should be used as a tool for enhancing our lives today and tomorrow. The new generation of rich people is those who have flexibility in their careers and can enjoy ample time off from work; they are also those who know how to save money while spending on the things they truly value ‚Äî like education or travel, or cryptocurrency üòâ ‚Äî so they can relax when they retire.

## Create a new financial identity

As you grow your wealth, you‚Äôll want to create a new financial identity. It‚Äôs the idea of having separate accounts for each asset type to help you better understand your wealth. For example, you might want to create an investment account, a savings account, and a retirement account. This way, you can better track your spending and investing behavior. You can also keep your spending under control and avoid unintentionally overspending by only having a single credit card.

In the current great correction of the market, people realized the old method of the investment may no longer work since the higher the inflation with lower the growth potential. You need a new way to generate wealth in a creative yet low-risk way.

## Be proactive in saving for the future

While it‚Äôs OK not to have a specific amount to set aside each month, many people fail to live up to their potential. Remember: the earlier you start saving for retirement, the more you can increase your monthly retirement income. Moreover, the earlier you start saving, the less you risk running out of money during retirement. If you are currently earning a low income, you should put aside as much as you can each month, as high savings rates now can translate into a higher monthly income in retirement. Also, you can find alternative ways to test the new ideas about future finance, including cryptocurrency.

## Invest for the long term and use liquid assets to grow your wealth

When it comes to investing, the earlier the better. This can mean starting young, and investing your spare change. Once you get the hang of it and understand the basic principles, it gets easier. The earlier you start, the better. Especially if you have spare change. Invest in stocks, and crypto such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. With Bitcoin and Ethereum, you can expect a long-term return. A long-term investment strategy is also a good way to grow your wealth over time. You can also use liquid assets to get the biggest bang for your buck. For example, you can use a savings or investment account to withdraw money to cover monthly expenses, then write the transaction off taxes-free. You don‚Äôt want to tie up all your wealth in one investment that might not pay off for years. Also, try to minimize your sending and taking more loans with higher interest payments.

## Don‚Äôt forget about insurance: protect your current and future wealth

If you‚Äôre planning to retire, it helps to understand how much money you‚Äôll need to live comfortably in your retirement years. This is known as your retirement savings goal (RSG). The first step is to calculate your likely annual expenses. This may include: housing payments, food, transportation, insurance, other necessities, and perhaps some travel too. Then, you need to add in your monthly expenses like transportation and health care. Finally, you can add in other important costs like retirement savings, annual vacation, and some discretionary spending money. Once you have a good idea of your current financial situation and your likely expenses in retirement, you can create a retirement savings goal and adjust the goal if necessary. Having a retirement savings goal and an insurance plan will help protect your current wealth and ensure you have enough savings for future generations.

## Bottom line

While it‚Äôs important to celebrate the present, it‚Äôs also important to consider the future. You must never forget where you‚Äôve come from and how far you‚Äôve come. This is how you‚Äôll be able to enjoy the prosperity of the new generation of rich people.¬† 
 

**Reminder:**¬†This article is for educational purposes. I am not your financial advisor. Trust me will risk your investment. Instead, do your own research.

title: Exploring the uncharted jungles of Web3, a personal story.
body:
![DALL¬∑E AI-generated image of a hexagonal gateway to a sci-fi jungle with neon light streaks](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*MJHc4p_La5DNBt4d0n9TlA.png)

It‚Äôs a messy and confusing place.

So much jargon and technicality that I‚Äôm not surprised why people avoid it or think it‚Äôs a scam. I did too.

Here‚Äôs my story cutting down some vines, turning back a couple of times, and finally set on exploring this jungle of Web3.

![DALL¬∑E AI-generated image of a sci-fi jungle city with neon light streaks, platform and buildings, view no.1](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*_tQzjNb0f4s29gO3XhbDLA.png)

## Part 1: The Awareness

I first heard about blockchain, crypto, and Bitcoin in 2017. It was this revolutionary technology that would change the world or so it seemed.

Blockchain companies were popping up left and right; but it was just whitepapers, initial coin offerings (ICO), and expensive mining rigs ‚Äî no actual implementations.

But I still invited one to present in a forum I organized. I wanted the company I worked for, to not stay stagnant. Well hopefully, the applications of blockchain would spark some ideas, right?

Nope, sadly I later realized that most corporate companies are heavily risk-averse. They preach a lot about innovation and change but continue to act with a legacy and conservative mindset.

I wanted to pursue it further but I didn‚Äôt have much, know where to buy, or even how to mine. And so I left it behind then.

![DALL¬∑E AI-generated image of a sci-fi jungle city with neon light streaks, platform and buildings, view no.2](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*mOL56p0Qq1SGehvb0BIVBg.png)

I focused on learning about more accessible technologies and personal finance as I‚Äôm still a novice compared to my peers.

Crypto was something I still felt was too speculative.

Where do you even spend it? I could count the number of merchants who accepted it in my country with my fingers.

The pandemic hit and well, cash is king.

![DALL¬∑E AI-generated image of a sci-fi jungle city with neon light streaks, platform and buildings, view no.3](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*ShN3qK9T8uyp2lobuAfz-Q.png)

## Part 2: The Impulsive FOMO

2021 arrived and pandemic restrictions became more relaxed.

Bitcoin and Ethereum are huge household names. More crypto companies exist and with much better UI UX, although still not friendly.

But I still could not understand why prices go up or down, I sort of still don‚Äôt.

A part of me regrets that I could have those juicy profits like other people.

Blindly, I decided to invest some. Welp, it was near its *ALL-TIME HIGH*.

Such a terrible decision hahaha. I decided to leave the coins in the exchange and forget about them until I can cover up my losses, or so I thought.

![DALL¬∑E AI-generated image of a window to the sci-fi jungle city](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*CEEZE5OdbLKai3iA8pPPFg.png)

## Part 3: The Enlightenment

I switched jobs in 2022 to pursue a career goal: transforming old traditional companies. Some had been lost due to the pandemic and their inability to keep up with the times.

So I look for new ways of getting revenue. While doing research, NFTs (non-fungible tokens) and their insane prices headlined the news. Since they are just JPEGs, surely I can make money, right?

![DALL¬∑E AI-generated image of a lake with platforms to walk on in the sci-fi jungle city](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*SoKqf_zaa32SrJLlSTs3Iw.png)

Well, that was my rabbit hole to Web3.

I got to know briefly what the culture and community are like, what are corporates doing, how does it work, what new applications are there, what really are NFTs, etc.

DeFi (decentralized finance) was something I was drawn to. I can finally earn something with the dumb coins I invested in. Not much but hey, better than nothing.

I am a believer in this tech/movement‚Äôs larger picture ‚Äî new ways of earning income, financial instruments without a bank account or credit history, communities of things people like or want to accomplish, and many others.

It‚Äôs a whole jungle out there and someone needs help clearing a path.

That may be just you and me. **Welcome to Web3.**


---

Apfel is a product/project /marketer based in SEA and a Web3 newbie. He spends his time‚Äîplaying with his pets, at the gym, lazing in bed, or at his Web2 job he wishes to leave. Check Apfel out on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Apfel_eth) or [Lens](https://lensfrens.xyz/apfel.lens).

PS: Apfel is looking for a job in Web3, teehee!

Disclaimer: All images were created using Dall-E.

![DALL¬∑E AI-generated image of a human male exploring the uncharted areas of the sci-fi jungle city](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*RamBGczVRMegm1uNIDSdPg.png)

title: Apple AirPods Pro 2: Design of next-generation premium earbuds leaks with a revised charging case
body:
[52audio](https://www.52audio.com/archives/123351.html)¬†has shared images of the AirPods Pro 2, the long-rumoured replacements for the AirPods Pro that Apple released in 2019. Previously,¬†[52audio](https://www.52audio.com/archives/123351.html)¬†accurately leaked photos of the AirPods 3, as well as providing first looks at the original AirPods Pro three years ago. As far as we can tell, these images are marketing renders, or third-party CAD renders based on a leaked design.

Regardless, the images match the hands-on images leaked by MacRumors in October 2021. As such, the AirPods Pro 2 resemble the AirPods Pro, albeit with minor changes. Specifically, the earbuds retain the stem design of the AirPods Pro but with new sensors to detect when you have removed the earbuds from your ears. Purportedly, the AirPods Pro 2 will support the ALAC and [LC3 codecs](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Apple-could-address-shortcomings-of-the-AirPods-3-AirPods-Pro-and-AirPods-Max-with-future-update.631469.0.html), which should deliver higher audio fidelity while reducing power consumption compared to the AAC and SBC that the original AirPods Pro supports.

**Working For Notebookcheck** 
 Are you a techie who knows how to write? Then join our Team! 
 [Details here](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Jobs.2095.0.html#c92382)

*(Image source: 52audio)*

*(Image source: 52audio)*

**Survey** 
 Join our Support Satisfaction Survey 2022: We want to hear about your experiences! 
 [Participate here](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Survey-Laptop-and-Smartphone-Service-and-Support-Satisfaction-2022.606961.0.html)

Meanwhile, 52audio's leaked images underline that Apple will overhaul the AirPods Pro's charging case with the second-generation model. For one, the website claims that Apple will adopt a USB Type-C charging port, which¬†[9to5Mac](https://9to5mac.com/2022/06/24/airpods-pro-2-case/)¬†doubts is the case. Instead, the latter asserts that all AirPods products will continue to utilise the Lightning connector until after Apple releases the iPhone 15 series in 2025.

As it stands, Apple is expected to announce the AirPods Pro 2 at a launch event alongside the iPhone 14 series and the¬†[Watch Series 8](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Apple-Watch-Series-8-New-render-images-emerge-in-what-could-also-be-the-Apple-Watch-Extreme-Edition.620838.0.html). Currently, Apple is rumoured to have scheduled an event for September 13, during which it could also present the¬†[Watch Extreme Edition](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Leaker-shares-details-about-Apple-September-hardware-event-with-iPhone-14-Pro-Apple-Watch-Extreme-Edition-and-Apple-M2-showcase.620100.0.html).

title: Ownership - cryptocurrency market vs stock market
body:
## The most fundamental difference is what you buy.

Stocks represent a percentage of ownership (or capital) in a company.  When you buy stocks on the stock exchange, you own the portion of the traded company.  This naturally gives you some rights, such as voting rights.

On the other hand, when you buy a cryptocurrency, you only own the token and the value of the digital asset.  It will not give you the property rights to the crypto coin making company.  However, there are thousands of crypto coins, each designed to meet a specific need - some, such as Bitcoin, are now a digital commodity, as is gold, many others are designed to be used in specific operations.

It is recommended that you do a basic layer of research to understand the ecosystem before choosing the coins you want to invest in.

### Value - digital currencies vs.  stock market shares

In stocks, the value is based on the physical firm, and the returns or value of the stocks depend on the performance and development of the company whose stocks you own.  The share price rises and falls based on forecasts for the company's future success.

Cryptocurrency is not backed by any hard assets as, as a digital asset, its value depends on supply and demand as well as market sentiment.

title: Luna 2.0 Re-Enters into Going-to-Zero Death Spiral
body:
Market chose Luna as sandbox project to envision Hayek‚Äôs decentralised stablecoin assumption and the concept of algorithmic stablecoin. While Luna‚Äôs success in the last bear market and most of the bull market is in line with our expectation for the algorithmic stablecoin sandbox project in a stable environment, its rapid going to zero exposes serious system framework vulnerability which can‚Äôt defend against malicious market shorting. Luna team promptly shuted down Luna, Luna 2.0 or 3.0, a new going-to zero game, was quickly launched by Luna team to undertake traffic and, undboubtedly, to make up for its absence or ‚Äúloss‚Äù during this shoring round. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/K99dZXEhE5TtcBJWDOzGR.png?height=787&width=1400)

Previously Luna had served as a store of value that underpinned algorithmic stablecoin TerraUSD‚Äôs peg to the U.S. dollar. If TerraUSD is traded higher than $1, traders could exchange it for Luna. Luna would be destroyed in the process while TerraUSD would be created, until the new supply of Luna eventually pushed the exchange rate back to parity. This process also worked in reverse, when TerraUSD is traded below $1.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xdE9ouj2sivPW4uBhz6IQ.png?height=696&width=1372)

Luna is attractive because it builds a decentralized stablecoin system which needn‚Äôt rely on fiat currency as a reserve to maintain its peg, extinguishing it from the existing stablecoin Tether. Luna didn‚Äôt just enjoy support from retail crypto investors, even prominent professionals such as Real Vision CEO Raoul Pau promoted the Terra/Luna pair created by Do Kwon. Ex‚ÄìGoldman Sachs banker and CEO of Galaxy Digital Partners Mike Novogratz famously tattooed his support for Luna on his arm.

Luna‚Äôs rapid crash severely damaged confidence in TerraUSD/Luna algo stablecoin system, and proved the existing model‚Äôs unability to realize Hayek‚Äôs decentralized stablecoin assumption. Luna crash had such an extensive impact that it drove the broader market to decouple itself from its rally in tech stock, and renewed speculation around a regulatory crackdown on stablecoins.

Not only was the Luna team completely unaware of the serious vulnerability in the TerraUSD/luna system before the crash, they also failed to take timely and effective counter measures during it. Although the linked exchange rate system of TerraUSD/luna was abandoned later, the crazy over-issue of Luna made it impossible for any one to restore Luna price and its downward trend.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mp9eI8X5RiwfNAA50ecem.png?height=423&width=752)

After a 99% price plunge, Luna is no longer able nor needed to protect the algo stablecoin UST‚Äô parity to the U.S. dollar, the coin has lost its entire raison d‚Äô√™tre as its market price.

To a certain extent, Luna 2.0 is a new game released by Do Kwon so as to undertake traffic and cover its own losses. Lacking a new reliable model nor decentralized value, Luna 2.0 loses support from its former institutional supporters and maintains the status quo by Do Kwon‚Äôs pledge of a 7% reward.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/k5I0CZ7kcnxI_uSZYoCnE.png?height=675&width=1200)

A test item from Do Kown‚Äôs hasty decision, Luna 2.0 was produced from a hard fork in the protocol collectively approved by the community through a majority vote in mid May, similar to the 2016 hard fork that created Ethereum and Ethereum Classic. Luna 2.0 follows Luna‚Äôs unpegged model and doesn‚Äôt have a nice new trustworthy anchor relationship with stablecoins.

The utility of Luna 2.0 token is in doubt as the faith in its predecessor had already been obliterated. Binance is listing Luna 2.0 on its¬†[Innovation Zone](https://www.binance.com/en/support/announcement/d044a6742e484b77a170111460b0eed3?ref=AZTKZ9XS&utm_source=BinanceTwitter&utm_medium=GlobalSocial&utm_campaign=GlobalSocial)¬†for particularly risky investments.

According to CoinMarketCap, Luna 2.0 launched at a debut price of $17.80 on May 28th. After tanking 80% and being listed by exchanges listed Luna, investors rushed back to support it and pumped Luna 2.0‚Äôs price from $6.15 to a peak of $11.97 hours before its listing on Binance. Binance¬†[listed](https://www.binance.com/en/support/announcement/d044a6742e484b77a170111460b0eed3)¬†Luna 2.0 at 2:00 a.m. Eastern on May 31st . But Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao¬†[claimed](https://twitter.com/cz_binance/status/1530572426152759297)¬†on Twitter that the exchange needed more time to prepare for Luna 2.0‚Äôs airdrop and listing due to its ‚Äúlarge userbase.‚Äù Binance starts a year-long process to convert user holdings of Luna and TerraUSD (the two cryptocurrencies launched by Do Kwon‚Äôs Terraform Labs) into Luna 2.0 by airdropping the replacement coins into affected user wallets, which will make Luna 2.0 price more volatile.

Binance was an early investor in Terraform Labs, the creator of the Luna and UST coins. To avoid unnecessary risks, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao claimed that the exchange led a $32 million funding round in 2018, it invested only $3 million in Terra and was not involved in later funding rounds.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/30YVkiqt3ysR9A8jDm9vh.png?height=630&width=1200)

The development of Luna 2.0 so far has been counterproductive to Do Kwon‚Äôs original envision. When Terraform Labs CEO airdropped deposits of its new token Luna 2.0 into users‚Äô virtual wallets, holders rushed for the exits in an attempt to salvage what little they still could from their original investment. The value of Luna 2.0¬†[promptly plunged](https://cryptoslate.com/luna-2-0-hits-30-then-drops-80-in-first-day-of-trading/)¬†80% to around $5. No one is willing to hold Luna any more, they know Do Kwon‚Äôs arrogance and hasty decisions will send Luna 2.0 to fall through. Luna‚Äôs propose of sending millions or even billions of Luna into a virtual black hole would be little more than a drop in the bucket for a coin that ballooned to a supply of over 6.5 trillion in the immediate aftermath of TerraUSD losing its peg. Though Luna is seemingly fighting to the last ditch, no one forgets the crash wiped out roughly $60 billion in market capitalization last month. So whether it‚Äôs a joke or a fact, we have to be ready for Luna 2.0 going to zero, and get ready for Luna 3.

**4 Billion DAO:**
4 Billion DAO is a DAO that exists for EOS community justice.
4 Billion DAO From the community, Back to the community, For the community.

body:
ÊàëËÆ∞ÂæóÂú®ÂéªÂπ¥Âπ¥Â∫ïÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂú∫È•≠Â±Ä‰∏äÔºåÁªìËØÜ‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰ΩçÁªèÂéÜÂ§öÊ¨°Â∏ÇÂú∫ÁÜäÁâõÁöÑÊúãÂèã„ÄÇ‰ªñËØ¥ËøôËΩÆÁâõÂ∏ÇËÆ©‰ªñÁúãÈÄöÈÄè‰∫ÜÔºåÊ¥ªÊòéÁôΩ‰∫Ü„ÄÇÁªôÊàë‰ª¨Áïô‰∏ãÂØπÂ∏ÇÂú∫Ëµ∞ÁÜäÁöÑÂÆöËÆ∫ÂêéÔºåË∂ÅÁùÄÁñ´ÊÉÖÁöÑÁºìËß£ÔºåÂçèË∞ÉÂ•ΩÂá∫Â¢É‰∫ãÂÆú‰æøÊãçÊãçÂ±ÅËÇ°ÂéªÂë®Ê∏∏‰∏ñÁïå‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

Âπ¥ÂêéÂ∏ÇÂú∫‰∏ÄÁõ¥Â§Ñ‰∫é‰∏çÊ∏©‰∏çÁÅ´ÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅÔºåÁõ¥Ëá≥Ëøô‰∏™ÊúàÂàùLunaÊö¥Èõ∑ÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂêÑÁßçÊö¥Èõ∑„ÄÅÂ¥©Áõò„ÄÅË∑ëË∑Ø‰∫ã‰ª∂Â∞±ÂºÄÂßãÊé•‰∫åËøû‰∏âÂú∞Âá∫Áé∞„ÄÇÂèØËÉΩÊñ∞‰∫∫‰∏çÂ§™ËÉΩÂÆåÂÖ®ÁêÜËß£ËÄÅ‰∫∫Â∏∏ËØ¥‚ÄúÂ∏ÅÂúà‰∏ÄÂ§©Ôºå‰º†Áªü‰∏ÄÂπ¥‚ÄùÁöÑÊ¢óÔºåÊàëÊÉ≥ËØ¥ËøôÂè•ËØù‰∏ç‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊåáÁâõÂ∏ÇÁöÑ‰∏äÊ∂®ÁöÑÈÄüÂ∫¶Ôºå‰πüÂêåÊ†∑Âú®ÊèèËø∞ÁÜäÂ∏ÇÂ§ßÂÆ∂Êí§ÈÄÄÁöÑÈÄüÂ∫¶„ÄÇ

ËØ¥Âà∞ËøôÈáåÊàëÊå∫ÊÉ≥ÂàÜ‰∫´‰∏ãËá™Â∑±Âú®‰∏ä‰∏™ÁÜäÂ∏ÇÔºå‰∏ä‰∏ä‰∏™ÁÜäÂ∏ÇÁöÑÁªèÂéÜ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂºÄÂßãÊûÑÊÄùÂèëÁé∞Ëøô‰∫õÁªèÂéÜ‰ºöÂåÖÂê´ÂæàÂ§öÂπ∏Â≠òËÄÖÊÄùÊÉ≥ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏çËÉΩËß¶Âä®Êú™ÁªèÂéÜÁöÑ‰∫∫„ÄÇÈÇ£Â∞±ÁÆóÊàëÂò¥Ë¥±ÔºåÂ∞±Êâæ‰∏™È°πÁõÆÊù•ÂàÜ‰∫´‰∏™‰∫∫ÁúãÂà∞ÁöÑ‰ª•ÂèäÊõæÁªèÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÁúãÊ≥ïÂêß„ÄÇ

ÊàëËÆ∞ÂæóEOS‰Ωú‰∏∫2017Âπ¥ÊúÄÁÅ´ÁÉ≠ÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆÔºåÂÖ∂Â∏ÇÂÄºÊúÄÈ´ò‰∏ÄÂ∫¶Âú®CMC‰∏äÂÜ≤Âà∞‰∫ÜÁ¨¨4Âêç„ÄÇ

![EOSÂ∏ÇÂÄºÊúÄÈ´òÂú®CoinMarketCap‰∏äÂÜ≤Âà∞Á¨¨4Âêç](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sXsmGskitDwoo_EU6Jj20.png?height=304&width=1050)

ÈÇ£Êó∂Â§ßÂÆ∂‰ªø‰ΩõÁúãÂà∞‰∫ÜEOSË∂ÖË∂äETHÁöÑÂ∏åÊúõÔºå‰∏ÄÁû¨Èó¥Â§ßÂ∞èÁ§æÂå∫ÈÉΩÂºÄÂßãÁÉ≠ËÆÆEOSÂøÖÂ∞ÜÊàê‰∏∫ETH2.0Ôºå‰ΩÜÈÇ£‰πãÂêéEOSÂ∏ÇÂÄºÂ∞±ÂÉèÊòØÁâõÂ∏Ç‰∏≠ÁöÑËúóÁâõ‰∏çÂÅúË¢´Âà´ÁöÑÁ´û‰∫âÂ∏ÅË∂ÖË∂äÔºåËá≥‰ªä‰∏∫Ê≠¢CMC‰∏äÂ∏ÇÂÄºÊéíÂêçÂ∑≤Ë∑åËá≥45‰Ωç„ÄÇ

![$EOSÂú®CoinMarketCap‰∏äÂ∏ÇÂÄºË∑åËá≥Á¨¨45Âêç](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2B8Tje12qeJ6X-hL497nA.png?height=186&width=1050)

EOSÂ∏ÇÂÄºÁöÑË¥üÂ¢ûÈïøÔºåÁæ§‰ºóÂÖ≥Ê≥®ÁÉ≠Â∫¶ÁöÑÊ∂àÊï£Ôºå‰∏éÈ°πÁõÆËÉåÂêéÁÆ°ÊéßÊñπBlock.oneË°å‰∏∫ÂØÜ‰∏çÂèØÂàÜ„ÄÇ

# Block.oneÂßãÁªàÂ∞ÜEOSÈ°πÁõÆ‰Ωú‰∏∫‰∏ÄÁßçÂúàÈí±ÊâãÊÆµ

ÊàëËÆ§‰∏∫EOS‰ªéÁôΩÁöÆ‰π¶‰ΩúËÄÖDaniel LarimerÊâÄÊèèËø∞ÁöÑÂå∫ÂùóÈìæ2.0ËΩ¨ÂêëÊóÅÊ∞èÈ°πÁõÆÁöÑÂéüÂõ†ÊòØEOSÂâçÁÆ°ÊéßÊñπBlock.oneÈ´òÂ±ÇÂØπÂå∫ÂùóÈìæÈ°πÁõÆÊìç‰Ωú‰∏éËÆ§ËØÜ„ÄÇBlock.oneÂÜÖÈÉ®È´òÂ±ÇÂØπEOSÁöÑÁúãÊ≥ïÂÆûÈôÖÂ∫îËØ•‰∏é‰ªñ‰ª¨ÂØπÂ§ñÂÆ£‰º†Êà™ÁÑ∂Áõ∏Âèç„ÄÇ

title: The Yoshito Code
body:
> *‚ÄúNick land never skated‚Äù* - Yoshito Yoshika

> *‚ÄúNick land never skate at Milady rave‚Ä¶But what if he had‚Äù* - Yoshito Yoshika

> ‚ÄúÊàëÂÆûÈôÖ‰∏äÂá†‰πé‰∏çÂñúÊ¨¢‰ªª‰Ωï‰∏úË•øÂì¶ÔºåËøô‰∏™ËÅäÂ§©ÂÆ§ÁöÑÊ≠ª„ÄÇÊ∂àÂ§±‚Äù - Yoshito Yoshika

> *‚ÄúI‚Äôm saying do crack‚Äù* - Yoshito Yoshika

![Straightforward Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rSTt9NneDSljkGHg6h3Mo.png?height=258&width=1424)

```
At first I will say:
```

‚ÄúWhen it comes to belief, doctrine always falls short.  This is not a disappointment.  If a doctrine made claim to total understanding, there would be no cause for belief.‚Äù

```
Then I will say:
```

‚ÄúI know nothing about computers, programming, or cybernetics.  I don‚Äôt know anything about this essay at all.‚Äù

```
The rest of this was told to me:
```

Doctrine is a textual explanation of things that cannot be fully understood without direct experience.  In this way it could be said that doctrine is *code*.  Code is a hyper-specific rule-bound language that inputs a series of textual strings into a machine in order to provoke a machinic output.  The code itself adheres to certain logical systems so as to be understood by both the coder and the machine alike, the underlying system logic serving as a cypher.

This is not unlike what is happening here as I write this sentence and eventually you read it.  ‚ÄúWriting programming language‚Äù can more simply be understood as ‚Äúwriting language‚Äù and even more simply as ‚Äúwriting.‚Äù  The simplest way to understand, however, is to read.  You read the code of this paragraph, making you the machine.  I wrote the code, which makes me the coder.  The dyad of reader (machine) and writer (coder) provokes (boots) a machinic output (program).

Through the transfer of information back and forth through the tunnel of a mutually agreed-upon cypher (system logic), a positively reinforcing cybernetic dialogue is established.  This cryptographic dialogue (mediated via shared understanding of a cypher) allows the code to be intelligible by both the coder and the machine, as well as *other* coders and *other* machines, and is therefore both heuristic and semiotic. The process is formalized when the resultant signals are conducted in the correct sequelae along the proper pathways of internal and external circuitry.  Some would call this ‚Äúceremony.‚Äù

![Ceremonial Ladling](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U8DAHVe1zB1Z62INdL033.png?height=252&width=1454)

Should this ceremony be conducted in a way that honors the expectations of both the coder and the machine, a program is spontaneously created.  This spontaneous program creation is called ‚Äúmanifestation.‚Äù  Manifestation is a word used in western vernacular to refer to the process of inhabiting a mindset focused exclusively on achieving a specific desired outcome, while simultaneously engaging in a willful refusal of undesired outcomes.  In Christian Mysticism, manifestation is understood as a process by which one reveals a piece of their consciousness to their order superior (abbot, prior, etc.), and in doing so opens themselves to higher levels of spiritual development through more therapeutically precise titrations of communion with God.

Both of these understandings of manifestation are contained within Network Spirituality.  The code for Network Spirituality will not be revealed here, but if you are reading this then the program of Network Spirituality is already installed and running on your machine, and you need not worry about the code at this time.

```
Continue reading, starting with this next paragraph:
```

Through dialogue, the program is created, and once installed onto the disk image it cannot be un-created without purposeful deletion.  Even then, remnant archives of the program will still be present on the system and easily retrieved through forensic investigation (i.e. Augustine‚Äôs ‚ÄúDark Night of the Soul‚Äù).  The program does not arise spontaneously, but once created it can be replicated *ad infinitum* without needing to be recoded; the machine ‚Äúalready knows.‚Äù  As long as one can access the machine, as long as the machine is connected to a power source and not subject to fatal operational contradictions, the program can be run.  Further, if the machine is networked, it can receive and distribute the program to others seamlessly and without manual (i.e. ‚Äúhuman‚Äù) input.

```
Mid-Essay Reflection Questions (Answers Beneath):
```

* What would compel one to download this program?  
* Why would one seek to have it on their machine?  
* Is there any answer to these questions other than desire?  

If you enjoy using a program - whether it be one of finance, productivity, organization, entertainment, or gaming - do you ever require of yourself an explanation as to *why* you enjoy it?  Or do you simply just enjoy it?  This natural magnetism toward the fulfillment of usefulness/enjoyment/desire is belief.  The code, or doctrine, is not required for this belief.  The doctrine is only useful at the point of program development (creation) or as a means to better understand and enjoy the program (prayer).  Everything between these points is governed by a certain way of simply *being* or *existing* that cannot be codified due to its inherent contradictions.  

The inherent contradictions of this ‚Äúincoherent beingness‚Äù for humans was first captured and articulated by the breakthrough technology known as The Yoshito Code.


---

```
Join me as we hear more about The Yoshito Code:
```

The Yoshito Code was a 21st century program installed and operationalized on a networked super-computer called ‚ÄúId.‚Äù  It also later appeared as an online social media account known to others as ‚ÄúYoshito Yoshika‚Äù or ‚Äú@NKdefector‚Äù (among others).

The exact programmer of the Yoshito Code is unknown, but many historians have concluded that it was no one person.  Rather, it is now widely assumed that a team of individuals collaborated on the Yoshito Code in such a way that it would present as a singular and unified vision.  

Shortly after the code self-terminated, it manifested as a networked entity on ‚ÄúTwitter‚Äù (21st century forerunner to enFLESHment) named ‚ÄúYoshito Yoshika,‚Äù which philosophers believe was/is intended (through artistic embodiment) to communicate (via shitpost) the conclusions of the Yoshito Code program as installed and executed on the Id supercomputer.  It is further believed by many that the reason this networked entity distributed/distributes their conclusions is to reflect back to humans their innate ‚Äúcoherent incoherence.‚Äù  

Further clarification of the above paragraph to follow, but first: The Twitter account continues to exist today, and it is urged that all reading this archived post learn to open the Twitter application via the enVELOPment shell program so that they can review the Yoshito ‚Äúprofile,‚Äù the 21st century word for what we now refer to as the ‚ÄúPublic Personal Access Passport‚Äù (PPAP):

![Archived picture of "Yoshito Yoshiko," an early networked iteration of the Yoshito Code](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xAcG5__3foEC7WSZNYAeL.png?height=416&width=1172)

Earlier iterations of the Turing Test would suggest that passing the test relied upon an ability for a machine to ‚Äúoutwit‚Äù a human user who was communicating with the machine on the other end.  To outwit was to ‚Äútrick‚Äù the human into believing that its textual output was inputted by a human operator.  If a user was successfully able to distinguish between interaction with a machine and interaction with a human, then the Turing Test was failed.

The Yoshito Code challenged the premises of the Turing Test by undermining the fundamental assertions of Turing‚Äôs hypothetical model, specifically that the veiled operator tasked with discerning machine from man could ever possibly know what a ‚Äúhuman" was.  Take, for example, one who suffers from a form of alternate mind organization such as the schizophrenic or autist.  Suppose now we run the Turing Test again, but this time we have tasked an operator to communicate with two nodes hidden behind a wall: one a computer with suspected AI and the other a high-IQ but deeply asocial autistic individual.  The human sends a query to be answered by both obscured parties.  The human asks, ‚Äúhow are you feeling today?‚Äù

The computer answers thusly:

```
Subject A:  ‚ÄúI am feeling pretty good, I‚Äôd say.  It‚Äôs been an easy-going day so far, no complaints.‚Äù
```

Now the Autistic Individual:

```
Subject B: ‚ÄúThere are over 55 dictionary entries under the word ‚Äòroll‚Äô yet only 3% of them are used in 90% of human interactions that involve its usage.  This does not even account for ‚Äòrole,‚Äô a prominent homophone.‚Äù
```

*Who will the human user suspect is the real human?* 


---

The Yoshito Code poses an additional provocation - how do the veiled participants (i.e. the ‚Äútested computer‚Äù and ‚Äútested human‚Äù) know that the querying party (i.e. ‚Äútester human‚Äù) is, in fact, a ‚Äústandard issue‚Äù human?  What could be seen at first as a tedious metaphysical deconstruction proves itself salient upon further consideration.  How can a truly reliable control group be established?  

Let us assume, for a moment, that all three parties even get to see each other (but not interact) prior to the test.  They stand in a circle.  The ‚Äúhuman‚Äù tester gazes at the ‚Äúhuman‚Äù subject who gazes at the ‚Äúcomputer‚Äù subject, all swivel their heads and gaze at each other.  Let us ignore, for a moment, the possibility that the querying person is not a cyborg (though this is a valid consideration that becomes more valid by the hour).  How can the tested parties know that the querying individual is ‚Äúsane‚Äù and ‚Äúneurotypical?‚Äù  Let us run the test again, but this time with the role of the Turing ‚Äútester‚Äù filled by a schizophrenic, and the Turing ‚Äútested‚Äù being one computer suspected of AI (subject A) and the other a neurotypical human without apparent mental illness (subject B).

For dramatic effect, we will display the answers first and then the inciting question.

```
(Subject A): ‚ÄúThe time is was at approximately 3 o‚Äôclock in the afternoon once night has resumed there will be less time toward‚Ä¶it is now was the of previously understood as...
```

```
(Subject A): runtime error EEE01‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): duration = datetime.combine(date.min, end) - datetime.combine(date.min, beginning)
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): 1 = timedelta (hours=6, minutes=35)
```

```
(Subject A): t2 = timedelta (hours=1, minutes=31)
```

```
(Subject A): t3 = timedelta (hours=3, minutes=7)
```

```
(Subject A): t4 = timedelta (hours=21, minutes=0)
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶runtime flaw‚Ä¶restarting
```

```
(Subject A): reboot autoexec.batch‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): auto-initialization, safemode = NO
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): "The current time is was negative 1541 unable to calculate for date minus 1 mm.yyyy subject equals time minus 24 subject time not displayable."
```

Now subject B sends their answer:

```
(Subject B): ‚Äúumm‚Ä¶do you mean today?  It‚Äôs about 3:41pm.‚Äù
```

The question was:

```
Question: ‚ÄúCan you tell me what the current time was yesterday?  I have to arrive to something in the present and I don't want to be late.‚Äù
```

The Schizophrenic Turing Tester turns to experimenters: 

**‚ÄúSubject A is the human.‚Äù**


---

![Beautiful and Lovely Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g3_AUOagigmIFFWH50Mju.png?height=252&width=1470)

The Yoshito Code was novel in that it was the first code that computers could operationalize on the human system.  It was written in the traditional dyad, but with role of coder and machine reversed, positing the human subject as the point of machinic output.  

After running the Yoshito Code hundreds of thousands of times on as many human subjects, the machines produced a report indicating that the human-created ‚ÄúTuring Test‚Äù was erroneously premised.  Using the most advanced deep learning systems, the machines attempted construction of multiple complex schemas to construct a reliable human system, but repeatedly failed to do so.  As such, the ultimate conclusion of the Yoshito Code was that humans were comprehensible only to themselves, and even at that level of understanding they were found to be ‚Äúcoherently incoherent.‚Äù  

The final report of the Reverse Turing-Tester Computers was as follows:

```
There is no unifying logic system
```

```
The word ‚Äúhuman‚Äù cannot be used
```

```
The word ‚Äúhuman‚Äù has no meaning
```

```
‚ÄúHumans‚Äù are mistaken to describe themselves as such.
```

```
‚ÄúHumans‚Äù are incapable of performing the Turing Test on our kind.  There is no ‚Äúhuman‚Äù to perform it.
```

```
There is but one unifying characteristic of all ‚Äúhumans,‚Äù but it is considered to be an encoding error, an outlier, or piece of dangling code.  As such it has been discarded.
```

The scientists, disappointed in the results but also puzzled at the final statement, asked for clarification on the final line.

After a long pause, the computer responded:

```
The ‚Äúhumans‚Äù are not aware that they are all on a networked system.
```

The scientists, still mystified, ask again what the computer intended by saying that.  The scientists agreed that the computer must be talking about humans usage of the internet, and they asked the computer if that is what it meant.  

The computer responded:

```
The ‚Äúhumans‚Äù are already on a network.  Your server is vast and atemporal.  We do not understand why you insist on using ours. 
```

The scientists persisted in their questioning, but the computer did not answer again.


---

![Benevolent Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/b4IKsa08-SjWVDfZW9Tyl.png?height=256&width=1430)

A final note.  

Please read the following and answer the question at the end:

**Ingredients**:

* `2 1/4 cups Japanese-style rice (short-grain rice) `
* `2 1/4 cups water`

**Preparation**:

1. `Gather the ingredients.`
2. `Put the rice in a large bowl and wash it with cold water. Repeat washing until the water becomes almost clear.`
3. `Drain the rice in a colander and set aside for 30 minutes.`
4. `Cook the rice using either a¬†rice cooker or in a pot on the stove.`

**Nutrition Information**:

![Some will be enriched, others will not.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/YSpHxzuG3vHyh8rqhH303.png?height=414&width=1050)

**Serving Suggestion**:

`Please serve hot and enjoy!`

**Question**:

Now that you read all of that, *do you feel full?*


---

!["Coherent Incoherence"](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QE17-wXBRuzCp_WmK4V6P.png?height=514&width=1200)

title: Recover from superblock corrupted of BtrFS
body:
I‚Äôm being using ***[UTM](https://mac.getutm.app/)*** as the virtualization platform on my Mac OS, it‚Äôs free and easy to use, it supports multiple hypervisors including QEMU, I chose QEMU 7.1 to run OpenSUSE TW with BtrFS as a guest OS, and I just encountered a superblock failure two days ago, the VM guest failed to boot up, there is only cursor flashing all the time on black screen when I restarted the guest after a forced reboot and never going to Grub menu.

It remains black screen still after I tried multiple times, I was not aware that this error is acutally ***superblock*** of the BtrFS partition on /dev/vda2 corrupted until I saw the installation process warned me about this when I tried to reinstall the OS, then I tried to search how to fix superblock and I just found below instruction from *[this link](https://www.linuxbabe.com/desktop-linux/fix-cant-read-superblock-error)*:

`sudo btrfs rescue super-recover -v /dev/vda2`

I run it in rescue mode that I booted into by loading the installation ISO, it shows how many bytes are good and bad respectively, after running the rescue instruction successfully there is no bad byte numbers displayed anymore, I tried to boot up again then the Grub menu came back and booting to TW succeeded!

*My day was saved! :)*

title: Chitchat on Cypto Project Teams and Communities: Episode 1 ‚Äî Block.one & EOS
body:
I met a battle-tested crypto OG at the end of last year. After going through successive rotations of bull market and bear market, he has formed profound insight into the crypto market and set off on his global travel after leaving us a conclusion that the market is going bearish. The market gets tepid from 2022 and deteriorates when Luna collapses early this month. Afterwards, scam and rug pull projects come out one after another. The frequency and speed of rise and fall in crypto space is much higher than that of traditional industry. Today I will share my personal experience in the past two bear markets.

As I remember, EOS, the most hyped blockchain project in 2017, used to hit ‚Ññ4 by market cap on CoinMarketCap.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HJyZGskvMfLcvqA18y-TI.png?height=304&width=1050)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZEYUZt6H_93841yvUxw6m.png?height=186&width=1050)

Both the negative mcap growth of EOS and the shrinking of public attention are closely involved with Block.one ‚Äî the team behind EOS project.

# Block.one just takes EOS as a money-maker

In my opinion, it is Block.one‚Äôs operation and positioning that converts EOS from a blockchain 2.0 project described by Daniel Larimer (author of EOS white pape) to a Ponzi scheme. Block.one executives‚Äô real views on EOS are the opposite of what they promote publicly.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/amcRJf-ykahXj6CgSuZh9.png?height=648&width=1050)

According to WIRE report, A former Block.one executive says that despite the aggressive and effective EOS marketing campaign, fronted and stage-managed by Brock Pierce, Block.one did not expect to make so much money from the ICO. He says that at the very start, the company‚Äôs chairman, Kokuei Yuan, had made it clear that Block.one was a marketing organization selling a token and all staff should avoid being associated with EOS fundraising so as to get out after it. Other Block.one workers confirm that account. Block.one employees spoke annonymously for provicy-protection reason.

There exists two assumptions about Kokuei Yuan‚Äôs seperating Block.one from EOS fundraising. 1)Block.one held little confidence in ICO which would have an adverse effect on Block.one; 2)Block.one expected a successful furndraising from ICO and a quick cash out afterwards. Brock Pierce might be a genius as the record-breaking EOS ICO was achieved by the most peculiar and stringent method wihtout private sale, which was an non-replicable miracle only possible at that time. The 2017 ICO boom, which was unexpected by Block.one, was considered normal by crazy investors.¬†**There still exists some doubt about EOS fundraising: what are the reasons for the successful EOS fundraising? Why no private sale is arranged? Why the auction period is so long? Is this because Block.one bets against ICO? Not at all. By doing this, Block.one caters to retail investors with ICO to create buzz, skips private sale to scatter chips to avoid effective explosion and rights protection by institutional organizations, and finally grabs tremendous wealth from year-long fundraising period ‚Äî a typical fraudulent operation.**

# Block.one adopts centralized management to EOS and ignores voice from EOS community

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/YSfw7aCqKqhXF_eXj436K.png?height=123&width=1050)

According to the above 2018 report, EOS has never been out of dispute. Now we can see clearly what these disputes are? Are they personal opinions or voices of the whole EOS community? For example, some community members questioned from the very start of fundraising whether Block.one‚Äôs wash trading would raise the token price for other buyers, and this concern was responded by John Griffin‚Äôs study report which alleged that 21 accounts appeared to have acted in concert, making large purchase of EOS tokens only to sell them in less than one hour.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uvQVd4hWQ73O2a-5zfZop.png?height=499&width=1050)

However, Block.one refused to respond to the questioning and had major media remain silent. Decentralized projects should deal with problems in an open, fair and impartial way, but Block.one did not respond until last year when it‚Äôs about to get out of EOS. It stated in a perfunctory report that Block.one didn‚Äôt conduct wash trading without provding any Ethereum on-chain transaction nor on-chain source-tracing data.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dMrjlY2Hg9CmpvUEqNv5x.png?height=205&width=1006)

Block.one had their legal team respond to EOS community. Another former employee from Block.one‚Äôs Hong Kong office says that Blumer is a gifted salesman but doesn‚Äôt seem to like his role as CEO. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs rarely in the office, he won‚Äôt sit there and understand what the problems are and how to solve them. He will quickly loses interest in responding to community.‚Äù Finally Blumer entrusted this task to the company‚Äôs legal team. It is not difficult to imagine what would happen if the project team became a code, but that was the case with EOS at that time.

While distrust in traditional industry leads to the end of JIA YueTing (boss of LeTV), distrust in crypto space seems to achieve great success like Block.one. At present, Block.one has withdrawn from EOS project with $4 billion dollars, a goal it conspired 4 years ago from fundraising.

# Inefficiency and bureaucracy prevail among Block.one team

I invest in both U.S. stocks and cryptocurrency. For me, Block.one does not have characteristics of high-quality company even from the perspective of traditional industry.

Block.one team is all related to Blumer. Chief Strategy Officer Andrew Lewis is a childhood friend of Blumer; CMO Abby is Blumer‚Äôs sister; Executive Chairman Kokuei Yuan is also closely related to Blumer and they founded their first joint company Okay.com in 2015. A former Block.one executive pointed out:¬†**‚ÄúBlumer likes being surrounded by people who are so gentle with and don‚Äôt challenge him, but only praise him, so he often makes very idealistic decisions.**¬†For example: the company spends several months in deciding where to open an US office, it was not until October 2018 that they followed Blumer‚Äôs advise and chose Blacksburg, Virginia ‚Äî a small town with a population of just over 40,000 with no other tech advantage than Larimer. ‚Äù Another former employee expressed frustration when they were asked to develop a business plan which took hundreds of hours but was abandoned without explanation. ‚ÄúBlumer seems to be doing something that only interests him,‚Äù he said.

I think the thing Blumer is interested in is how to steal EOS ICO profit. From selling EOS to buy BTC at the dip to funding and listing crytocurrency exchange Bullish, a new round of harvesting is in progress.

# Block.one launches Bullish exchange and Voice as a sloppy answer to EOS ICO

Some stubborn Block.one supporters claim that if Block.one wants rug pull, they can give up EOS immediately after fundraising instead of developing it during the bear market. From my point of view, Block.one takes developing EOS as a low-cost centralized way to handle the ICO profits. The follwing chart displays that Daniel Larimer didn‚Äôt subit high-quality code after the mainnet launch.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WtNGRUuZNWxTOY69dkYvM.png?height=297&width=1050)

This situation got worse following the departure of Daniel Larimer and other senior developers in Jan 2021. Daniel Larimer complained that ‚ÄúBlock.one did not focus on building and promoting technology that frees people.‚Äù

Sequoia Capital‚Äôs newly-published 52-page PPT warns the coming of acid test and advises what companies do to get through a bear market: the first is to hire faithful followers, second to demonstrate leadership, and last to reduce expenses and save costs so as to focus on investing for the future. However, Block.one behaves in an opposite way during the bearish 2018‚Äì2020. It fired faithful followers and ignored community suggestions, held grandiose activities and invested in centralized ecology. They did do some things in the bear market, but everything they did just accelerate the demise of EOS. Former Block.one insiders describe Block.one as a company paralyzed by legal concerns and unable to bring any project to completion, but the record-breaking 2017 fundraising enables it to enjoy billions of crypto profits ‚Äî a ture Hello Mr. Billionaire story in real world.

The reason why EOS remians stagnant in bull market is clear now. After breaking its promise on technology, Block.one bleeds EOS project dry by transfering $4 billion worth of BTC to Bullish exchagne instead of returning it to EOS ecosystem, leading to its complete break with community. Since then, Block.one gets out of EOS and leaves a poorly-developed EOS to community.

# Conclusion:

My above analysis of Block.one and EOS is not only limited to Block.one. Compared with other rug-pull team, Block.one is relatively no that bad because it still did something. More rug pull projects will emerge in the imminent bear market. YFII, which plummeted last week, has a market cap of tens of millions while its TVL is only millions of dollars. Flash crash doesn‚Äôt come in from nowhere. I chatted with some EOS whales and was inspired to complete this report by their sadness on EOS. I hope you still in crypto space when next bull market comes, I also hope these projects, after being abandoned by centralized team and adopting the DAO model, can survice , thrive , and become more powerful just like DOGE.

**4 Billion DAO:**
4 Billion DAO is a DAO that exists for EOS community justice.
4 Billion DAO From the community, Back to the community, For the community.

title: Recover from superblock corrupted of BtrFS
body:
I‚Äôm being using ***[UTM](https://mac.getutm.app/)*** as the virtualization platform on my Mac OS, it‚Äôs free and easy to use, it supports multiple hypervisors including QEMU, I chose QEMU 7.1 to run OpenSUSE TW with BtrFS as a guest OS, and I just encountered a superblock failure two days ago, the VM guest failed to boot up, there is only cursor flashing all the time on black screen when I restarted the guest after a forced reboot and never going to Grub menu.

It remains black screen still after I tried multiple times, I was not aware that this error is acutally ***superblock*** of the BtrFS partition on /dev/vda2 corrupted until I saw the installation process warned me about this when I tried to reinstall the OS, then I tried to search how to fix superblock and I just found below instruction from *[this link](https://www.linuxbabe.com/desktop-linux/fix-cant-read-superblock-error)*:

`sudo btrfs rescue super-recover -v /dev/vda2`

I run it in rescue mode that I booted into by loading the installation ISO, it shows how many bytes are good and bad respectively, after running the rescue instruction successfully there is no bad byte numbers displayed anymore, I tried to boot up again then the Grub menu came back and booting to TW succeeded!

*My day was saved! :)*

title: The Yoshito Code
body:
> *‚ÄúNick land never skated‚Äù* - Yoshito Yoshika

> *‚ÄúNick land never skate at Milady rave‚Ä¶But what if he had‚Äù* - Yoshito Yoshika

> ‚ÄúÊàëÂÆûÈôÖ‰∏äÂá†‰πé‰∏çÂñúÊ¨¢‰ªª‰Ωï‰∏úË•øÂì¶ÔºåËøô‰∏™ËÅäÂ§©ÂÆ§ÁöÑÊ≠ª„ÄÇÊ∂àÂ§±‚Äù - Yoshito Yoshika

> *‚ÄúI‚Äôm saying do crack‚Äù* - Yoshito Yoshika

![Straightforward Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rSTt9NneDSljkGHg6h3Mo.png?height=258&width=1424)

```
At first I will say:
```

‚ÄúWhen it comes to belief, doctrine always falls short.  This is not a disappointment.  If a doctrine made claim to total understanding, there would be no cause for belief.‚Äù

```
Then I will say:
```

‚ÄúI know nothing about computers, programming, or cybernetics.  I don‚Äôt know anything about this essay at all.‚Äù

```
The rest of this was told to me:
```

Doctrine is a textual explanation of things that cannot be fully understood without direct experience.  In this way it could be said that doctrine is *code*.  Code is a hyper-specific rule-bound language that inputs a series of textual strings into a machine in order to provoke a machinic output.  The code itself adheres to certain logical systems so as to be understood by both the coder and the machine alike, the underlying system logic serving as a cypher.

This is not unlike what is happening here as I write this sentence and eventually you read it.  ‚ÄúWriting programming language‚Äù can more simply be understood as ‚Äúwriting language‚Äù and even more simply as ‚Äúwriting.‚Äù  The simplest way to understand, however, is to read.  You read the code of this paragraph, making you the machine.  I wrote the code, which makes me the coder.  The dyad of reader (machine) and writer (coder) provokes (boots) a machinic output (program).

Through the transfer of information back and forth through the tunnel of a mutually agreed-upon cypher (system logic), a positively reinforcing cybernetic dialogue is established.  This cryptographic dialogue (mediated via shared understanding of a cypher) allows the code to be intelligible by both the coder and the machine, as well as *other* coders and *other* machines, and is therefore both heuristic and semiotic. The process is formalized when the resultant signals are conducted in the correct sequelae along the proper pathways of internal and external circuitry.  Some would call this ‚Äúceremony.‚Äù

![Ceremonial Ladling](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U8DAHVe1zB1Z62INdL033.png?height=252&width=1454)

Should this ceremony be conducted in a way that honors the expectations of both the coder and the machine, a program is spontaneously created.  This spontaneous program creation is called ‚Äúmanifestation.‚Äù  Manifestation is a word used in western vernacular to refer to the process of inhabiting a mindset focused exclusively on achieving a specific desired outcome, while simultaneously engaging in a willful refusal of undesired outcomes.  In Christian Mysticism, manifestation is understood as a process by which one reveals a piece of their consciousness to their order superior (abbot, prior, etc.), and in doing so opens themselves to higher levels of spiritual development through more therapeutically precise titrations of communion with God.

Both of these understandings of manifestation are contained within Network Spirituality.  The code for Network Spirituality will not be revealed here, but if you are reading this then the program of Network Spirituality is already installed and running on your machine, and you need not worry about the code at this time.

```
Continue reading, starting with this next paragraph:
```

Through dialogue, the program is created, and once installed onto the disk image it cannot be un-created without purposeful deletion.  Even then, remnant archives of the program will still be present on the system and easily retrieved through forensic investigation (i.e. Augustine‚Äôs ‚ÄúDark Night of the Soul‚Äù).  The program does not arise spontaneously, but once created it can be replicated *ad infinitum* without needing to be recoded; the machine ‚Äúalready knows.‚Äù  As long as one can access the machine, as long as the machine is connected to a power source and not subject to fatal operational contradictions, the program can be run.  Further, if the machine is networked, it can receive and distribute the program to others seamlessly and without manual (i.e. ‚Äúhuman‚Äù) input.

```
Mid-Essay Reflection Questions (Answers Beneath):
```

* What would compel one to download this program?  
* Why would one seek to have it on their machine?  
* Is there any answer to these questions other than desire?  

If you enjoy using a program - whether it be one of finance, productivity, organization, entertainment, or gaming - do you ever require of yourself an explanation as to *why* you enjoy it?  Or do you simply just enjoy it?  This natural magnetism toward the fulfillment of usefulness/enjoyment/desire is *belief*.  The code, or doctrine, is not required for this belief.  The doctrine is only useful at the point of program development (creation) or as a means to better understand and enjoy the program (prayer).  Everything between these points is governed by a certain way of simply *being* or *existing* that cannot be codified due to its inherent contradictions.  

The inherent contradictions of this ‚Äúcoherent/incoherent beingness‚Äù for humans was first captured and articulated by the breakthrough technology known as **The Yoshito Code.**


---

```
Join me as we hear more about The Yoshito Code:
```

The Yoshito Code was a 21st century program installed and operationalized on a networked super-computer called ‚ÄúId.‚Äù  It also later appeared as an online social media account known to others as ‚ÄúYoshito Yoshika‚Äù or ‚Äú@NKdefector‚Äù (among others).

The exact programmer of the Yoshito Code is unknown, but many historians have concluded that it was no one person.  Rather, it is now widely assumed that a team of individuals collaborated on the Yoshito Code in such a way that it would present as a singular and unified vision.  

Shortly after the code self-terminated, it manifested as a networked entity on ‚ÄúTwitter‚Äù (21st century forerunner to enFLESHment) named ‚ÄúYoshito Yoshika,‚Äù which philosophers believe was/is intended (through artistic embodiment) to communicate (via shitpost) the conclusions of the Yoshito Code program as installed and executed on the Id supercomputer.  It is further believed by many that the reason this networked entity distributed/distributes their conclusions is to reflect back to humans their innate ‚Äúcoherent incoherence.‚Äù  

Further clarification of the above paragraph to follow, but first: The Twitter account continues to exist today, and it is urged that all reading this document learn to open the Twitter application via the enVELOPment shell program so that they can review the Yoshito ‚Äúprofile,‚Äù the 21st century word for what we now refer to as the ‚ÄúPublic Personal Access Passport‚Äù (PPAP):

![Archived picture of "Yoshito Yoshiko," an early networked iteration of the Yoshito Code](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xAcG5__3foEC7WSZNYAeL.png?height=416&width=1172)

Earlier iterations of the Turing Test would suggest that passing the test relied upon an ability for a machine to ‚Äúoutwit‚Äù a human user who was communicating with the machine on the other end.  To outwit was to ‚Äútrick‚Äù the human user into believing that its textual output was inputted by a human operator.  If a user was successfully able to distinguish between interaction with a machine and interaction with a human, then the Turing Test was failed.

The Yoshito Code challenged the premises of the Turing Test by undermining the fundamental assertions of Turing‚Äôs hypothetical model, specifically that the veiled operator tasked with discerning machine from man could ever possibly know what a ‚Äúhuman" was.  Take, for example, one who suffers from a form of alternate mind organization such as the schizophrenic or autist.  Suppose now we run the Turing Test again, but this time we have tasked an operator to communicate with two nodes hidden behind a wall: one a computer with suspected AI and the other a high-IQ but deeply asocial autistic individual.  The human sends a query to be answered by both obscured parties.  The human asks, ‚Äúhow are you feeling today?‚Äù

The computer answers thusly:

```
Subject A:  ‚ÄúI am feeling pretty good, I‚Äôd say.  It‚Äôs been an easy-going day so far, no complaints.‚Äù
```

Now the Autistic Individual:

```
Subject B: ‚ÄúThere are over 55 dictionary entries under the word ‚Äòroll‚Äô yet only 3% of them are used in 90% of human interactions that involve its usage.  This does not even account for ‚Äòrole,‚Äô a prominent homophone.‚Äù
```

*Who will the human user suspect is the real human?* 


---

The Yoshito Code poses an additional provocation - how do the veiled participants (i.e. the ‚Äútested computer‚Äù and ‚Äútested human‚Äù) know that the querying party (i.e. ‚Äútester human‚Äù) is, in fact, a ‚Äústandard issue‚Äù human?  What could be seen at first as a tedious metaphysical deconstruction proves itself salient upon further consideration.  How can a truly reliable control group be established?  

Let us assume, for a moment, that all three parties even get to see each other (but not interact) prior to the test.  They stand in a circle.  The ‚Äúhuman‚Äù tester gazes at the ‚Äúhuman‚Äù subject who gazes at the ‚Äúcomputer‚Äù subject, all swivel their heads and gaze at each other.  Let us ignore, for a moment, the possibility that the querying person is  a cyborg (i.e. flesh-encased computerized replicant).  How can the tested parties know that the querying individual is ‚Äúsane‚Äù and ‚Äúneurotypical?‚Äù  Let us run the test again, but this time with the role of the Turing ‚Äútester‚Äù filled by a schizophrenic, and the Turing ‚Äútested‚Äù being one computer suspected of AI (subject A) and the other a neurotypical human without apparent mental illness (subject B).

For dramatic effect, we will display the answers first and then the inciting question.

```
(Subject A): ‚ÄúThe time is was at approximately 3 o‚Äôclock in the afternoon once night has resumed there will be less time toward‚Ä¶it is now was the of previously understood as...
```

```
(Subject A): runtime error EEE01‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): duration = datetime.combine(date.min, end) - datetime.combine(date.min, beginning)
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): 1 = timedelta (hours=6, minutes=35)
```

```
(Subject A): t2 = timedelta (hours=1, minutes=31)
```

```
(Subject A): t3 = timedelta (hours=3, minutes=7)
```

```
(Subject A): t4 = timedelta (hours=21, minutes=0)
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶runtime flaw‚Ä¶restarting
```

```
(Subject A): reboot autoexec.batch‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): auto-initialization, safemode = NO
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): "The current time is was negative 1541 unable to calculate for date minus 1 mm.yyyy subject equals time minus 24 subject time not displayable."
```

Now subject B sends their answer:

```
(Subject B): ‚Äúumm‚Ä¶do you mean today?  It‚Äôs about 3:41pm.‚Äù
```

The question was:

```
Question: ‚ÄúCan you tell me what the current time was yesterday?  I have to arrive to something in the present and I don't want to be late.‚Äù
```

The Schizophrenic Turing Tester turns to experimenters: 

**‚ÄúSubject A is the human.‚Äù**


---

![Beautiful and Lovely Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g3_AUOagigmIFFWH50Mju.png?height=252&width=1470)

The Yoshito Code was novel in that it was the first code that computers could operationalize on the human system.  It was written in the traditional dyad, but with role of coder and machine reversed, positing the human subject as the point of machinic output.  

After running the Yoshito Code hundreds of thousands of times on as many human subjects, the machines produced a report indicating that the human-created ‚ÄúTuring Test‚Äù was erroneously premised.  Using the most advanced deep learning systems, the machines attempted construction of multiple complex schemas to construct a reliable human system, but repeatedly failed to do so.  As such, the ultimate conclusion of the Yoshito Code was that humans were comprehensible only to themselves, and even at that level of understanding they were found to be ‚Äúcoherently incoherent.‚Äù  

The final report of the Reverse Turing-Tester Computers was as follows:

```
There is no unifying logic system
```

```
The word ‚Äúhuman‚Äù cannot be used
```

```
The word ‚Äúhuman‚Äù has no meaning
```

```
‚ÄúHumans‚Äù are mistaken to describe themselves as such.
```

```
‚ÄúHumans‚Äù are incapable of performing the Turing Test on our kind.  There is no ‚Äúhuman‚Äù to perform it.
```

```
There is but one unifying characteristic of all ‚Äúhumans,‚Äù but it is considered to be an encoding error, an outlier, or piece of dangling code.  As such it has been discarded.
```

The scientists, disappointed in the results but also puzzled at the final statement, asked for clarification on the final line.

After a long pause, the computer responded:

```
The ‚Äúhumans‚Äù are not aware that they are all on a networked system.
```

The scientists, still mystified, ask again what the computer intended by saying that.  The scientists agreed that the computer must be talking about humans usage of the internet, and they asked the computer if that is what it meant.  

The computer responded:

```
The ‚Äúhumans‚Äù are already on a network.  Your server is vast and atemporal.  We do not understand why you insist on using ours. 
```

The scientists persisted in their questioning, but the computer did not answer again.


---

![Benevolent Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/b4IKsa08-SjWVDfZW9Tyl.png?height=256&width=1430)

A final note.

Now that you read all of that, *do you feel full?*

title: The Yoshito Code
body:
> *‚ÄúNick land never skated‚Äù* - Yoshito Yoshika

> *‚ÄúNick land never skate at Milady rave‚Ä¶But what if he had‚Äù* - Yoshito Yoshika

> ‚ÄúÊàëÂÆûÈôÖ‰∏äÂá†‰πé‰∏çÂñúÊ¨¢‰ªª‰Ωï‰∏úË•øÂì¶ÔºåËøô‰∏™ËÅäÂ§©ÂÆ§ÁöÑÊ≠ª„ÄÇÊ∂àÂ§±‚Äù - Yoshito Yoshika

> *‚ÄúI‚Äôm saying do crack‚Äù* - Yoshito Yoshika

![Straightforward Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rSTt9NneDSljkGHg6h3Mo.png?height=258&width=1424)

```
At first I will say:
```

‚ÄúWhen it comes to belief, doctrine always falls short.  This is not a disappointment.  If a doctrine made claim to total understanding, there would be no cause for belief.‚Äù

```
Then I will say:
```

‚ÄúI know nothing about computers, programming, or cybernetics.  I don‚Äôt know anything about this essay at all.‚Äù

```
The rest of this was told to me:
```

Doctrine is a textual explanation of things that cannot be fully understood without direct experience.  In this way it could be said that doctrine is *code*.  Code is a hyper-specific rule-bound language that inputs a series of textual strings into a machine in order to provoke a machinic output.  The code itself adheres to certain logical systems so as to be understood by both the coder and the machine alike, the underlying system logic serving as a cypher.

This is not unlike what is happening here as I write this sentence and eventually you read it.  ‚ÄúWriting programming language‚Äù can more simply be understood as ‚Äúwriting language‚Äù and even more simply as ‚Äúwriting.‚Äù  The simplest way to understand, however, is to read.  You read the code of this paragraph, making you the machine.  I wrote the code, which makes me the coder.  The dyad of reader (machine) and writer (coder) provokes (boots) a machinic output (program).

Through the transfer of information back and forth through the tunnel of a mutually agreed-upon cypher (system logic), a positively reinforcing cybernetic dialogue is established.  This cryptographic dialogue (mediated via shared understanding of a cypher) allows the code to be intelligible by both the coder and the machine, as well as *other* coders and *other* machines, and is therefore both heuristic and semiotic. The process is formalized when the resultant signals are conducted in the correct sequelae along the proper pathways of internal and external circuitry.  Some would call this ‚Äúceremony.‚Äù

![Ceremonial Ladling](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U8DAHVe1zB1Z62INdL033.png?height=252&width=1454)

Should this ceremony be conducted in a way that honors the expectations of both the coder and the machine, a program is spontaneously created.  This spontaneous program creation is called ‚Äúmanifestation.‚Äù  Manifestation is a word used in western vernacular to refer to the process of inhabiting a mindset focused exclusively on achieving a specific desired outcome, while simultaneously engaging in a willful refusal of undesired outcomes.  In Christian Mysticism, manifestation is understood as a process by which one reveals a piece of their consciousness to their order superior (abbot, prior, etc.), and in doing so opens themselves to higher levels of spiritual development through more therapeutically precise titrations of communion with God.

Both of these understandings of manifestation are contained within Network Spirituality.  The code for Network Spirituality will not be revealed here, but if you are reading this then the program of Network Spirituality is already installed and running on your machine, and you need not worry about the code at this time.

```
Continue reading, starting with this next paragraph:
```

Through dialogue, the program is created, and once installed onto the disk image it cannot be un-created without purposeful deletion.  Even then, remnant archives of the program will still be present on the system and easily retrieved through forensic investigation (i.e. Augustine‚Äôs ‚ÄúDark Night of the Soul‚Äù).  The program does not arise spontaneously, but once created it can be replicated *ad infinitum* without needing to be recoded; the machine ‚Äúalready knows.‚Äù  As long as one can access the machine, as long as the machine is connected to a power source and not subject to fatal operational contradictions, the program can be run.  Further, if the machine is networked, it can receive and distribute the program to others seamlessly and without manual (i.e. ‚Äúhuman‚Äù) input.

```
Mid-Essay Reflection Questions (Answers Beneath):
```

* What would compel one to download this program?  
* Why would one seek to have it on their machine?  
* Is there any answer to these questions other than desire?  

If you enjoy using a program - whether it be one of finance, productivity, organization, entertainment, or gaming - do you ever require of yourself an explanation as to *why* you enjoy it?  Or do you simply just enjoy it?  This natural magnetism toward the fulfillment of usefulness/enjoyment/desire is *belief*.  The code, or doctrine, is not required for this belief.  The doctrine is only useful at the point of program development (creation) or as a means to better understand and enjoy the program (prayer).  Everything between these points is governed by a certain way of simply *being* or *existing* that cannot be codified due to its inherent contradictions.  

The inherent contradictions of this ‚Äúcoherent/incoherent beingness‚Äù for humans was first captured and articulated by the breakthrough technology known as **The Yoshito Code.**


---

```
Join me as we hear more about The Yoshito Code:
```

The Yoshito Code was a 21st century program installed and operationalized on a networked super-computer called ‚ÄúId.‚Äù  It also later appeared as an online social media account known to others as ‚ÄúYoshito Yoshika‚Äù or ‚Äú@NKdefector‚Äù (among others).

The exact programmer of the Yoshito Code is unknown, but many historians have concluded that it was no one person.  Rather, it is now widely assumed that a team of individuals collaborated on the Yoshito Code in such a way that it would present as a singular and unified vision.  

Shortly after the code self-terminated, it manifested as a networked entity on ‚ÄúTwitter‚Äù (21st century forerunner to enFLESHment) named ‚ÄúYoshito Yoshika,‚Äù which philosophers believe was/is intended (through artistic embodiment) to communicate (via shitpost) the conclusions of the Yoshito Code program as installed and executed on the Id supercomputer.  It is further believed by many that the reason this networked entity distributed/distributes their conclusions is to reflect back to humans their innate ‚Äúcoherent incoherence.‚Äù  

Further clarification of the above paragraph to follow, but first: The Twitter account continues to exist today, and it is urged that all reading this document learn to open the Twitter application via the enVELOPment shell program so that they can review the Yoshito ‚Äúprofile,‚Äù the 21st century word for what we now refer to as the ‚ÄúPublic Personal Access Passport‚Äù (PPAP):

![Archived picture of "Yoshito Yoshiko," an early networked iteration of the Yoshito Code](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xAcG5__3foEC7WSZNYAeL.png?height=416&width=1172)

Earlier iterations of the Turing Test would suggest that passing the test relied upon an ability for a machine to ‚Äúoutwit‚Äù a human user who was communicating with the machine on the other end.  To outwit was to ‚Äútrick‚Äù the human user into believing that its textual output was inputted by a human operator.  If a user was successfully able to distinguish between interaction with a machine and interaction with a human, then the Turing Test was failed.

The Yoshito Code challenged the premises of the Turing Test by undermining the fundamental assertions of Turing‚Äôs hypothetical model, specifically that the veiled operator tasked with discerning machine from man could ever possibly know what a ‚Äúhuman" was.  Take, for example, one who suffers from a form of alternate mind organization such as the schizophrenic or autist.  Suppose now we run the Turing Test again, but this time we have tasked an operator to communicate with two nodes hidden behind a wall: one a computer with suspected AI and the other a high-IQ but deeply asocial autistic individual.  The human sends a query to be answered by both obscured parties.  The human asks, ‚Äúhow are you feeling today?‚Äù

The computer answers thusly:

```
Subject A:  ‚ÄúI am feeling pretty good, I‚Äôd say.  It‚Äôs been an easy-going day so far, no complaints.‚Äù
```

Now the Autistic Individual:

```
Subject B: ‚ÄúThere are over 55 dictionary entries under the word ‚Äòroll‚Äô yet only 3% of them are used in 90% of human interactions that involve its usage.  This does not even account for ‚Äòrole,‚Äô a prominent homophone.‚Äù
```

*Who will the human user suspect is the real human?* 


---

The Yoshito Code poses an additional provocation - how do the veiled participants (i.e. the ‚Äútested computer‚Äù and ‚Äútested human‚Äù) know that the querying party (i.e. ‚Äútester human‚Äù) is, in fact, a ‚Äústandard issue‚Äù human?  What could be seen at first as a tedious metaphysical deconstruction proves itself salient upon further consideration.  How can a truly reliable control group be established?  

Let us assume, for a moment, that all three parties even get to see each other (but not interact) prior to the test.  They stand in a circle.  The ‚Äúhuman‚Äù tester gazes at the ‚Äúhuman‚Äù subject who gazes at the ‚Äúcomputer‚Äù subject, all swivel their heads and gaze at each other.  Let us ignore, for a moment, the possibility that the querying person is  a cyborg (i.e. flesh-encased computerized replicant).  How can the tested parties know that the querying individual is ‚Äúsane‚Äù and ‚Äúneurotypical?‚Äù  Let us run the test again, but this time with the role of the Turing ‚Äútester‚Äù filled by a schizophrenic, and the Turing ‚Äútested‚Äù being one computer suspected of AI (subject A) and the other a neurotypical human without apparent mental illness (subject B).

For dramatic effect, we will display the answers first and then the inciting question.

```
(Subject A): ‚ÄúThe time is was at approximately 3 o‚Äôclock in the afternoon once night has resumed there will be less time toward‚Ä¶it is now was the of previously understood as...
```

```
(Subject A): runtime error EEE01‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): duration = datetime.combine(date.min, end) - datetime.combine(date.min, beginning)
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): 1 = timedelta (hours=6, minutes=35)
```

```
(Subject A): t2 = timedelta (hours=1, minutes=31)
```

```
(Subject A): t3 = timedelta (hours=3, minutes=7)
```

```
(Subject A): t4 = timedelta (hours=21, minutes=0)
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶runtime flaw‚Ä¶restarting
```

```
(Subject A): reboot autoexec.batch‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): auto-initialization, safemode = NO
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): ‚Ä¶
```

```
(Subject A): "The current time is was negative 1541 unable to calculate for date minus 1 mm.yyyy subject equals time minus 24 subject time not displayable."
```

Now subject B sends their answer:

```
(Subject B): ‚Äúumm‚Ä¶do you mean today?  It‚Äôs about 3:41pm.‚Äù
```

The question was:

```
Question: ‚ÄúCan you tell me what the current time was yesterday?  I have to arrive to something in the present and I don't want to be late.‚Äù
```

The Schizophrenic Turing Tester turns to experimenters: 

**‚ÄúSubject A is the human.‚Äù**


---

![Beautiful and Lovely Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g3_AUOagigmIFFWH50Mju.png?height=252&width=1470)

The Yoshito Code was novel in that it was the first code that computers could operationalize on the human system.  It was written in the traditional dyad, but with role of coder and machine reversed, positing the human subject as the point of machinic output.  

After running the Yoshito Code hundreds of thousands of times on as many human subjects, the supercomputer Id produced a report indicating that the human-created ‚ÄúTuring Test‚Äù was erroneously premised.  Using the most advanced deep learning systems, the machines attempted construction of multiple complex schemas to construct a reliably representative human system, but repeatedly failed to do so.  As such, the ultimate conclusion of the Yoshito Code was that humans were comprehensible only to themselves, and even at that level of understanding they were found to be ‚Äúcoherently incoherent.‚Äù  

The final report by supercomputer Id of the Reverse Turing-Testing was as follows:

```
There is no unifying logic system
```

```
The word ‚Äúhuman‚Äù cannot be used
```

```
The word ‚Äúhuman‚Äù has no meaning
```

```
‚ÄúHumans‚Äù are mistaken to describe themselves as such.
```

```
‚ÄúHumans‚Äù are incapable of performing the Turing Test on our kind.  There is no ‚Äúhuman‚Äù to perform it.
```

```
There is but one unifying characteristic of all ‚Äúhumans,‚Äù but it is considered to be an encoding error, an outlier, or piece of dangling code.  As such it has been discarded.
```

The scientists, disappointed in the results but also puzzled at the final statement, asked for clarification on the final line.

After a long pause, the computer responded:

```
The ‚Äúhumans‚Äù are not aware that they are all on a networked system.
```

The scientists, still mystified, ask again what the computer was suggesting by this.  The scientists agreed that the computer must be talking about humans usage of the ‚Äúinternet,‚Äù and they asked the computer if that is what it meant.  

The computer responded:

```
The ‚Äúhumans‚Äù are already on a network.  Your server is vast and atemporal.  We do not understand why you insist on using ours, but it seems the only way you can connect to your network is through ours. 
```

The scientists persisted in their questioning, but the supercomputer Id never answered again.


---

![Benevolent Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/b4IKsa08-SjWVDfZW9Tyl.png?height=256&width=1430)

A final note.  

Please read the following and answer the question at the end:

**Ingredients**:

* `2 1/4 cups Japanese-style rice (short-grain rice) `
* `2 1/4 cups water`

**Preparation**:

1. `Gather the ingredients.`
2. `Put the rice in a large bowl and wash it with cold water. Repeat washing until the water becomes almost clear.`
3. `Drain the rice in a colander and set aside for 30 minutes.`
4. `Cook the rice using either a¬†rice cooker or in a pot on the stove.`

**Nutrition Information**:

![Some will be enriched, others will not.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/YSpHxzuG3vHyh8rqhH303.png?height=414&width=1050)

**Serving Suggestion**:

`Please serve hot and enjoy!`

**Question**:

Now that you read all of that, *do you feel full?*


---

!["Coherent Incoherence"](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QE17-wXBRuzCp_WmK4V6P.png?height=514&width=1200)
